column3: str
Weidheri is in need of a helping hand.
Deliver bottles of arak to the soldiers of Ala Ghiri.
Speak with Weidheri.
Oi, adventurer. If you're planning to linger a while, would you mind making a small delivery for me?
I thought I'd give the soldiers a sample of my wares, as a show of appreciation for taking back Ala Ghiri. With all these customers, though, I'm too busy by half.
Would you mind passing around a few bottles of this here spirits? I'm sure they've worked up quite a thirst.
After all they've done for us, a few bottles of spirits is the least I can offer to thank them.
Is there something I can help you with, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>?
A bottle of spirits? Why, how generous of them. With my shift ending soon, this is just what I needed to relax.
Yes? What is it?
Oh my, a bottle of Gyr Abanian spirits. I take it the people here are in a celebrating mood? Hmmm... I think I'll go and have a drink right now.

<If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>Gods, am I thirsty...<Else/>Why is it so insufferably hot today...</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>Why is it so insufferably hot today...<Else/>Gods, am I thirsty...</If></If>
A bottle of spirits to celebrate? This couldn't have come at a better time. Thank you.
The Gyr Abanians always were a hospitable lot. Thankfully some things never change.

<If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>Good evening<Else/>Good morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>Good day<Else/>Good evening</If></If>, adventurer. What can I do for you?
That's awfully kind of you. Obviously I can't drink this now, but pass along my thanks all the same.
It's an awfully tempting gift, but I really should wait until my watch is over.
Thanks for that. Nothing like a bottle of spirits to lift one's spirits, I always say.
<sigh> Ala Ghiri's been through so much over the years. It does my heart good to know we can breathe free again.
That's why I decided to give these brave soldiers my very best bottles of arak. It's a special brew made right here in Ala Ghiri.
To be honest I'm not sure how I'll replenish my stocks, but it's worth it to see everyone enjoying themselves. We've had enough worrying to last us a lifetime.
For now I say we drink, and enjoy the taste of victory.
